description: It is the year 20XX. Earth has been assaulted by monsters known as 'the Enemy of Humanity'. In order to deal with this threat, special schools comprised of teenagers with extraordinary abilities were formed. These people, who came to be known as 'the Talented', have abilities that defy the rules of reality. Among these superpowered individuals was an outlier, someone who was sent to one of these schools despite having no innate special abilities whatsoever. This is the story of our protagonist, who attempts to defeat the Enemies of Humanity through the use of intelligence and manipulation.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Detective
tags.description: Features a character who investigates and solves crimes.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Espionage
tags.description: Prominently features characters infiltrating an organization in order to steal sensitive information.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Rural
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the countryside.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Necromancy
tags.description: When the dead are summoned as spirits, skeletons, or the undead, usually for the purpose of gaining information or to be used as a weapon.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

title.native: 無能なナナ ミニアニメ

node.description: Game scenario writer of notable visual novel like Sharin no Kuni, A Profile and G-Senjou no Maou, all developed by the japanese company AkabeiSoft2.   It was stated by the author himself that he likes to listen to classical music while working, and that those pieces will be used to fit in the scene he was writing. For example the Bach compositions in G-Senjou no Maou.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/志茂文彦) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fumihiko_Shimo)

Noted for writing the scripts for Kyoto Animation's anime adaptations of Key visual novels.

Began his career as a production assistant on [Grave of the Fireflies](https://anilist.co/anime/578/), but switched to writing right after.

[Profile](http://artist.amuse.co.jp/artist/tomita_miyu/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/miyu-tomita/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/miyju_tomita) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomita__miyu._/)

The Grand Prix winner of the 2014 Seiyuu Artist Training Program Selection competition, which was sponsored by Amuse and Ken Production. After being scouted by six talent agencies, she eventually joined Amuse.

She made her voice acting debut in 2015, voicing a number of unnamed characters in Himouto Umaru-chan.

Non-Anime Roles
• Layla - Genshin Impact (VG)
• Zara - Memento Mori (VG)
• New Jersey - Azur Lane (VG)
• Jiu Niangzi - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

__[Website](https://fujikawachiai.com/profile/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Nippon Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/artist-info/fujikawachiai/prof.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujikawachiai)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fujikawa_chiai/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPn4XA6Gb2u8y_FXXtrHW7w)__

__Height:__ 162 cm
__Graduated:__ Okayama Prefectural Kasaoka Commercial High School

__Introduction:__
Chiai Fujikawa is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Nippon Columbia (2018-). Before going solo she was a lead singer in the idol group Maneki Kecak, between July of 2015 until her departure from the group in September of 2018. She has additionally performed at the Nippon Budokan, which took place on September 24 of 2018.

Activities as a solo artist began after debuting at "TOKYO CULTURE CULTURE", where she held an Acoustic Live event on November 25 of 2018, this was followed-up with her first album release on May of 2019, titled "Raika".

__Biography:__
After graduating high school, Chiai aimed to become a singer while working at a factory. She mentions how she wanted to write her own lyrics whenever she became an artist, so she had been writing poems in her notebooks since she was a student. Whenever she came up with a word, sentence, or anything that could be used in a song, she would write it in a notepad she kept on her phone.
_Note: Not to be confused with either the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/197092/) or the [CG artist](https://anilist.co/staff/163284/)._
